communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Human Experimentation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all lab reports, surgical reports, and operative reports before, during, and after surgery regarding human experimentation performed  at Boston Children’s Hospital between 1960 and 1970. The lab reports should include: a title, abstract, introduction, method, results, discussion and conclusion. Also please include reports from the patient history program if any of the subjects participated in such programs. The information from such a program should include;   patient's medical history, symptoms, diagnoses, procedures, lab results, and demographic information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Rivellino JR

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew  Ma, Thank you for registering with the CDCR PUBLIC RECORDS PORTAL. Your Login ID is:  186617-26418612@requests.muckrock.com If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request and receive any documents in response to your request.

communications.subject: Institution :: I027504-051525
communications.communication:
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS ACT REQUEST of 5/15/2025, Reference # I027504-051525 Dear Andrew Ma, 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation (CDCR). Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the California Public Records Act, Government Code section 7920.000 et seq. Your request was received on May 15, 2025 and given the reference number I027504-051525 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-corrections-and-rehabilitation-905%252Frequest-for-correctional-mental-health-staff-directory-and-contact-information-department-of-corrections-and-rehabilitation-186617%252F%253Femail%253DMichelle.Mraule%252540cdcr.ca.gov&url_auth_token=AAAaFGRS18MHN-tCfvkRoT-pZ0M%3A1uFl0p%3A7Gr0CyLlkaYeesuuHjNiHQe7qTfu5OSD8-WWtj-jGWY 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant CDCR department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs that may be associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The California Public Records Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
CA Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the CDCR PUBLIC RECORDS PORTAL

communications.subject: [Records Center] Institution :: I027504-051525
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS ACT REQUEST May 15, 2025, Reference # I027504-051525 

Dear Andrew Ma, 

This letter is in response to your Public Records Act request dated May 15, 2025, in which you requested the following records: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information. 

Specifically, I am requesting: 

- Full names 
- Job titles 
- Assigned correctional facility 
- Government-issued email addresses 
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions) 
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services) 

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities. 

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Andrew Ma 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-corrections-and-rehabilitation-905%252Frequest-for-correctional-mental-health-staff-directory-and-contact-information-department-of-corrections-and-rehabilitation-186617%252F%253Femail%253DMichelle.Mraule%252540cdcr.ca.gov&url_auth_token=AAAaFGRS18MHN-tCfvkRoT-pZ0M%3A1uFl0p%3A7Gr0CyLlkaYeesuuHjNiHQe7qTfu5OSD8-WWtj-jGWY" 

The CA Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation is unable to respond to your request because CDCR does not exercise control over the records you are requesting. The records you seek may be in the possession of the California Correctional Health Care Services. Please forward a copy of your request directly to California Correctional Health Care Services by email at CCHCSHealthPRAs@cdcr.ca.gov or by mail to the following address: 

California Correctional Health Care Services 
Attention: PRA Coordinator Building C 
P.O. Box 588500 
Elk Grove, CA 95758 

If you have any questions or need additional information, you can manage your request through the CDCR PUBLIC RECORDS PORTAL. 

Sincerely, 

Kayla Ronzone 
PRA Coordinator
